text: was an old province of Japan in the area of Tottori Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Hōki" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 343. It was sometimes called . The province had borders with Inaba, Mimasaka, Bitchū, Bingo, and Izumo Provinces. The ancient capital city of the province was near Kurayoshi. A major castle town was at Yonago. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. The maps of Japan and Izu Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Shrines and Temples== Shitori jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Hōki.
